text: goal gtSummarisedResult …

text: can install development version gtSummarisedResult GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(gtSummarisedResult) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Create a nice table from a summarised_result object. — formatSummarisedResult
title: Create a nice table from a summarised_result object. — formatSummarisedResult
text: Create nice table summarised_result object.

title: Create a nice table from a summarised_result object. — formatSummarisedResult
code: formatSummarisedResult(   result,   tableType = "gt",   header = NULL,   estimateNameFormat = NULL,   style = "default",   decimals = c(integer = 0, numeric = 2, percentage = 2, proportion = 3),   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   caption = NULL,   .options = list() )

title: Create a nice table from a summarised_result object. — formatSummarisedResult
text: result summarised_result object. tableType Type table format (currently accepting "gt"). header Names columns make headers. Names corresponding column table result, used headers defined position. estimateNameFormat Named list estimate name's join, sorted computation order. style Named list specifies style different parts table. Accepted entries : title, subtitle, header, header_name, header_level, column_name, group_label, body. NULL, table styled (deafult chosed tableType), "deafult" styled OMOP's deafult. decimals Number decimals per estimate_type (integer, numeric, percentage, proportion). title Title table, NULL title. subtitle Subtitle table, NULL subtitle. caption Caption table, NULL caption. Text markdown formatting style (e.g. *caption * caption italics). .options list deafult options (includeHeaderName = TRUE, keepNotFormatted = TRUE, decimalMark = ".", bigMark = ",", na = "-", groupNameCol = NULL, groupNameAsColumn = FALSE, groupOrder = NULL).

title: Create a nice table from a summarised_result object. — formatSummarisedResult
text: formatted table summarisedResult dataframe.

title: Create a nice table from a summarised_result object. — formatSummarisedResult

# \donttest{ mockSummarisedResult() |> formatSummarisedResult(tableType = "gt", header = c("Study strata","strata_name", "strata_level"), estimateNameFormat = c("N(%)" = "count (percentage%)"), style = "default", decimals = c( integer = 0, numeric = 2, percentage = 1, proportion = 3 ), .options = list("groupNameCol" = "group_level", "groupNameAsColumn" = FALSE, "groupOrder" = c("cohort1", "cohort2"), "includeHeaderName" = FALSE)) #>

what: Creats a gt table from a tibble using as deliminter (delim) for spanners. — gtTable
title: Creats a gt table from a tibble using as deliminter (delim) for spanners. — gtTable
text: Creats gt table tibble using deliminter (delim) spanners.

title: Creats a gt table from a tibble using as deliminter (delim) for spanners. — gtTable
code: gtTable(   x,   delim = "\n",   style = list(header = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#c8c8c8"), gt::cell_text(weight =     "bold")), header_name = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1"), gt::cell_text(weight =     "bold")), header_level = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#ffffff"), gt::cell_text(weight     = "bold")), column_name = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold"))),   na = "-",   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   caption = NULL,   groupNameCol = NULL,   groupNameAsColumn = FALSE,   groupOrder = NULL )

title: Creats a gt table from a tibble using as deliminter (delim) for spanners. — gtTable
text: x dataframe. delim Delimiter. style Named list specifies style different parts table. Accepted entries : title, subtitle, header, header_name, header_level, column_name, group_label, body. na display missing values. title Title table, NULL title. subtitle Subtitle table, NULL subtitle. caption Caption table, NULL caption. Text markdown formatting style (e.g. *caption * caption italics). groupNameCol Column use group labels. groupNameAsColumn Whether display group labels column (TRUE) rows (FALSE). groupOrder Order display group labels.

title: Creats a gt table from a tibble using as deliminter (delim) for spanners. — gtTable
text: gt table.

title: Creats a gt table from a tibble using as deliminter (delim) for spanners. — gtTable
code:
# \donttest{ mockSummarisedResult() |> formatEstimateValue(decimals = c(integer = 0, numeric = 1)) |> spanHeader(header = c("Study strata", "strata_level"), includeHeader = FALSE) |> gtTable( style = list("header" = list( gt::cell_fill(color = "#d9d9d9"), gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), "header_level" = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1"), gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), "column_name" = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold")), "title" = list(gt::cell_text(weight = "bold"), gt::cell_fill(color = "#c8c8c8")), "group_label" = gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1")), na = "--", title = "gtTable example", subtitle = NULL, caption = NULL, groupNameCol = "group_level", groupNameAsColumn = FALSE, groupOrder = c("cohort1", "cohort2") ) #>
